stress_test_results.methodology: 3 alternative weight vectors tested on top 20 C6 models
stress_test_results.architecture_insight: Physical: 86.4 convergence > 86.1 compounding > 83.1 force. Data compounding: 88.1 force > 86.6 compounding > 81.0 convergence. Physical = more durable. Digital = more force.

key_insight: CYCLE 7 VALIDATES AND EXTENDS THE LANDSCAPE. (1) SCORING IS ROBUST: 7 of top 10 survive ALL weight vectors. Current weights aren't arbitrary. (2) PHYSICAL vs DIGITAL IS NUANCED: physical = more durable (highest convergence resistance), digital data compounding = more force (largest TAM). Strategy unchanged: START physical (timing windows), BUILD digital parallel (compounding). (3) NAICS BOTTOM-UP > TOP-DOWN: systematic NAICS screening discovers sectors invisible to theme scanning. Printing (28K estabs), building trades (2.46M workers), allied health (191K estabs) all entered top 20. (4) MATRIX IS COMPLETE: 80 cells mapped. 16 impossible. 12 unexplored now filled. (5) PE DISTRESS IS MULTI-SECTOR: extends beyond accounting to veterinary, dental, staffing, printing.
